search_multi.highlightHint: Left-click for next; Right-click for previous
search_multi.explain: Search for files that meet any of the following conditions
search_multi.scope.name: File Name (without extension)
search_multi.scope.head: Heading
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.syntax: Multi-Fields File Searcher finds text files by combining multiple conditions. Each condition consists of three parts: scope, operator, and operand. E.g. {{eg}} (meaning: file size greater than 2kb)
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.combineCond.and: Use AND to connect conditions that must all be satisfied. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.combineCond.or: Use OR to connect conditions where at least one must be satisfied. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.combineCond.not: Add NOT before a condition to negate it. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.combineCond.parentheses: Use parentheses to adjust operator precedence. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintHeader.scope: Scope: Which property to search in
search_multi.modal.hintHeader.operator: Operator: The relationship between scope and operand
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.operator.colon: Contains match or Regular Expression match. Used for text content, indicating that the search scope contains or regular matches the search value
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.operator.equal: Strict equality / inequality. Used for exact comparison of text, numerical, or boolean values
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.operator.compare: Numerical comparison. Used for numerical attributes, such as file size or time
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.operand.quotes: Text enclosed in double quotes signifies an exact match for the entire phrase. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.operand.regex: Text enclosed in slashes indicates the use of a JavaScript-style regular expression for advanced pattern matching. E.g. {{eg}}
search_multi.modal.hintDetail.syntacticSugar: For simplicity, scope and operator can be omitted. Default scope is {{scope}} (path and content), default operator is {{operator}} (contains). Thus, {{shortCond}} equals {{normalCond}}, which equals {{longCond}}, meaning: search for files where path or content contains 'pear'.
search_multi.modal.example.desc6: Matches the regex \bsour\b (whole word match for sour), and contains pear, and the file modification time is earlier than 2024-05-16
search_multi.modal.example.desc7: YAML Front Matter contains dev, or heading content is plugin, or bold text contains MIT
search_multi.modal.example.desc8: File size exceeds 10KB, and either the file has at least 1000 lines or it contains an image
search_multi.modal.example.desc9: File path contains info or warn or err, and extension does not contain md
search_multi.modal.example.desc10: Table header contains k8s, and H2 contains prometheus, and BlockCode content contains 'kubectl apply'
search_multi.$label.BACKSPACE_TO_HIDE: Hide Window on Empty and Backspace

auto_number.$label.LAYOUTS.name: Name
auto_number.$label.ENABLE_WHEN_EXPORT: Keep Numbering When Exporting to HTML/PDF
auto_number.$hintDetail.layoutSyntax: Numbering format uses the structure "Prefix{Name:Style}Suffix". Here, Prefix and Suffix are arbitrary text, and {} is the counter placeholder. Name specifies the object being numbered, and Style specifies how the number is displayed. You can freely combine text and multiple counters within the format string.
auto_number.$hintDetail.counterNames: Counter names include: c1~c6 (H1~H6 in Content), o1~o6 (H1~H6 in Outline), t1~t6 (H1~H6 in TOC), t (Table), i (Image), and f (FencedCode)
auto_number.$hintDetail.counterStyles: Counter styles include: d (Decimal, default), dlz (Decimal Leading Zero), lr (Lower Roman), ur (Upper Roman), la (Lower Alpha), ua (Upper Alpha), lg (Lower Greek), hs (Heavenly Stem), eb (Earthly Branch), cjk (CJK ideographs), di (Disc), ci (Circle), and sq (Square)
